p: The species is distributed on rocky, sunny habitats, mainly on the carbonate rock base in the Eastern and Middle Stara Planina (Balkan Mountains) [ 7]. The morphological features of M. frivaldszkyana are typical for the species from the same family, namely grassy, perennial plants; stems 15â€“30 cm high; strongly branched; ovoid leaves; and serrated, abaxial surface with small glands rich in EO. The plant flowers are white or pale pink, outwardly short-haired, and gathered in loose-cut inflorescences. The fruits are nutlets, up to 1 mm long, brown, and with a smooth surface. The plant is propagated with seeds [ 5].
